summary: A confidential letter to Judge Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application, written by an unnamed individual who describes Maxwell as a wonderful person, denies her involvement in Epstein's crimes, and details the severe media harassment and threats they have faced due to their association with Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the bail application; the author describes her as a wonderful and loving person who had nothing to do with Epstein's crimes and is committed to staying in the U.S. to clear her name.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as having a previous relationship with Maxwell; his arrest and death in custody in summer 2019 triggered intense media coverage. The author states they never met nor communicated with him.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The recipient of this letter regarding Maxwell's bail application.

persons.name: Judge Salas
persons.context: Mentioned as an example of violence born from conspiracy theories, referencing an attack on her.

connections.description: The document references Maxwell's 'previous relationship' with Epstein, though the author claims Maxwell had nothing to do with his crimes.
The author writes in strong support of Maxwell's bail, describing her as a wonderful person they know well and have never witnessed acting inappropriately.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest and Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and subsequently died in custody in the summer of 2019, which triggered an explosion of media interest.

events.title: Maxwell's Arrest
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in July 2020, which came as a shock to the author.

events.title: Bail Application Submission
events.description: The date this letter of support for Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application was submitted to Judge Nathan.

keyFacts: An unnamed individual wrote a confidential letter to Judge Nathan in November 2020 vehemently supporting Ghislaine Maxwell's bail, claiming she is a wonderful person who had nothing to do with Jeffrey Epstein's crimes.
The author details severe personal consequences from media harassment, including threatening messages, being stalked, and 'life-altering' losses due to their association with Maxwell.
The letter states Maxwell had numerous opportunities to flee the U.S. over the preceding years but chose to stay to fight the allegations and clear her name.
The author draws parallels between the media frenzy around Maxwell and dangerous conspiracy theories like QAnon and Pizzagate, specifically citing the attack on Judge Salas.
The author expresses prayers for justice, Maxwell's safety, her due process, and also for Epstein's victims.
